intro: Frailea schilinzkyana subsp. concepcionensis, commonly known as the Concepción frailea, is a compact, stemless cactus native to the Canary Islands. It features a globular to cylindrical body covered in white to pale green tubercles. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the summer months, which are borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it has a dense covering of fine, white hairs. It is well adapted to arid conditions and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
